monolith.subtext: A single, large application handling multiple tasks.

content.heading: Monolith
paragraphs: A monolith is a large, single software application that handles multiple tasks. It's like having one big machine that does everything, from washing clothes to making coffee.
Imagine a monolith as an all-in-one tool that can be harder to fix if something breaks.

dataWarehouse.title: Data Warehouse
dataWarehouse.subtext: System for storing and managing large data for analysis.

content.heading: Data Warehouse
paragraphs: A Data Warehouse is a system used to store and manage large amounts of data for analysis. It's like a giant library where all the books are organized for easy searching.
Think of a Data Warehouse as a super-organized bookshelf that makes finding information quick and easy.

graphDatabases.title: Graph Databases
graphDatabases.subtext: Databases storing data in nodes and edges to show relationships.

content.heading: Graph Databases (e.g., Neo4j)
paragraphs: Graph Databases store data in nodes and edges, which show relationships. It's like a web of connections, like a social network map.
Imagine a Graph Database as a map of your friendships, showing who knows who.

apm.title: APM (Application Performance Management)
apm.subtext: Monitors and manages software application performance.

content.heading: APM (Application Performance Management)
paragraphs: APM monitors and manages the performance and availability of software applications. It's like having a fitness tracker for your software, showing how healthy it is.
Think of APM as a doctor for your apps, keeping them in top shape.

content.heading: Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
paragraphs: IaC is managing and provisioning computing infrastructure through machine-readable scripts. It's like using a recipe to automatically make a cake.
Imagine IaC as writing instructions for a robot to set up your computer systems.

immutableInfrastructure.title: Immutable Infrastructure
immutableInfrastructure.subtext: Infrastructure that is never modified after deployment.

content.heading: Immutable Infrastructure
paragraphs: Immutable Infrastructure means servers are never modified after deployment; they're replaced with new ones. It's like using a new sheet of paper for each new drawing.
Imagine Immutable Infrastructure as using new Lego pieces each time you build something new.

distributedLedgerTechnology.title: Distributed Ledger Technology
distributedLedgerTechnology.subtext: Digital system recording transactions in multiple places simultaneously.

content.heading: Distributed Ledger Technology
paragraphs: Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) is a digital system for recording transactions where details are recorded in multiple places at the same time. It's like having multiple copies of a book to prevent losing any information.
Think of DLT as sharing your diary with friends to ensure everyone has the same stories.

chaosEngineering.title: Chaos Engineering
chaosEngineering.subtext: Practice of testing systems to withstand turbulent conditions.

content.heading: Chaos Engineering
paragraphs: Chaos Engineering is the practice of experimenting on a system to build confidence in its ability to withstand turbulent conditions. It's like testing a bridge by simulating strong winds.
Imagine Chaos Engineering as stress-testing your structures to ensure they can handle unexpected events.

reactiveProgramming.title: Reactive Programming
reactiveProgramming.subtext: Handling data streams and changes in real time.

content.heading: Reactive Programming
paragraphs: Reactive Programming is a way to handle data streams and changes in real time. It's like making sure your app can react instantly to user inputs, like a game that updates immediately when you press a button.
Imagine Reactive Programming as being able to respond quickly to events, just like a reflex.

dataSharding.title: Data Sharding
dataSharding.subtext: Splitting a database into smaller, faster parts.

content.heading: Data Sharding
paragraphs: Data Sharding splits a large database into smaller, faster, more manageable parts. It's like cutting a big pizza into slices so everyone can have a piece.
Imagine data sharding as dividing your work among friends to get it done faster.

apiGateway.title: API Gateway
apiGateway.subtext: Manages requests and directs them to the correct services.

content.heading: API Gateway
paragraphs: An API Gateway is like a front door that handles all requests from clients, ensuring they get directed to the right services. It's like a receptionist who directs calls to the correct department.
Imagine an API Gateway as a helpful guide that makes sure everyone gets to where they need to go.

webRTC.title: WebRTC (Web Real-Time Communication)
webRTC.subtext: Enabling real-time communication directly in web browsers.

content.heading: WebRTC (Web Real-Time Communication)
paragraphs: WebRTC allows real-time communication in web browsers without needing special plugins. It's like a video call that works instantly in your browser.
Imagine WebRTC as a way to talk to your friends face-to-face through your browser, no extra apps needed.

dataGovernance.title: Data Governance
dataGovernance.subtext: Management of data's availability, usability, integrity, and security.

content.heading: Data Governance
paragraphs: Data Governance is the management of data's availability, usability, integrity, and security. It's like making sure your library's books are organized, accessible, and protected.
Think of Data Governance as setting rules and responsibilities for handling data properly.

dataAnonymization.title: Data Anonymization
dataAnonymization.subtext: Removing personal identifiers from data to protect privacy.

content.heading: Data Anonymization
paragraphs: Data Anonymization removes personal information from data sets so that individuals can't be identified. It's like blurring faces in a photo to protect people's privacy.
Imagine Data Anonymization as making sure no one can recognize the people in your photos.

federatedLearning.title: Federated Learning
federatedLearning.subtext: Training AI models across multiple devices without sharing data.

content.heading: Federated Learning
paragraphs: Federated Learning is a way to train AI models across multiple devices without sharing raw data. It's like learning from everyone's notebooks without taking them away.
Imagine Federated Learning as combining knowledge from many sources while keeping the original notes private.

explainableAI.title: Explainable AI (XAI)
explainableAI.subtext: Making AI decisions understandable to humans.

content.heading: Explainable AI (XAI)
paragraphs: Explainable AI (XAI) is about making AI decisions understandable to humans. It's like having a teacher explain how they solved a math problem.
Imagine XAI as getting a step-by-step explanation for how an AI reached its conclusion.

syntheticData.title: Synthetic Data
syntheticData.subtext: Artificially generated data that mimics real data.

content.heading: Synthetic Data
paragraphs: Synthetic Data is artificially generated data that mimics real data. It's like creating a fake ID that looks real but isn't linked to a real person.
Imagine Synthetic Data as a practice exam that helps you prepare for the real test without using real questions.

quantumCryptography.title: Quantum Cryptography
quantumCryptography.subtext: Using principles of quantum mechanics for secure communication.

content.heading: Quantum Cryptography
paragraphs: Quantum Cryptography uses the principles of quantum mechanics to secure data. It's like using a secret code that only works with the laws of physics.
Imagine Quantum Cryptography as an unbreakable lock that can only be opened with a special quantum key.

digitalTwins.title: Digital Twins
digitalTwins.subtext: Virtual replicas of physical objects or systems.

content.heading: Digital Twins
paragraphs: Digital Twins are virtual replicas of physical objects or systems. It's like having a digital version of yourself that can try things out before you do.
Imagine Digital Twins as having a virtual clone to test new ideas without any risk.

edgeAI.title: Edge AI
edgeAI.subtext: Bringing artificial intelligence to edge devices to process data locally.

content.heading: Edge AI
paragraphs: Edge AI brings artificial intelligence to devices at the edge of the network, closer to where data is collected. It's like having a smart assistant right where you need it.
Imagine Edge AI as having a mini-brain in your device that makes decisions without waiting for instructions from a central server.

homomorphicEncryption.title: Homomorphic Encryption
homomorphicEncryption.subtext: Performing computations on encrypted data without decryption.

content.heading: Homomorphic Encryption
paragraphs: Homomorphic Encryption allows computations on encrypted data without decrypting it. It's like solving a puzzle without seeing the pieces.
Imagine Homomorphic Encryption as doing math with secret numbers that only make sense when you finish the calculation.

fogComputing.title: Fog Computing
fogComputing.subtext: Extending cloud computing to the edge of an enterprise's network.

content.heading: Fog Computing
paragraphs: Fog Computing extends cloud computing to the edge of the network, processing data closer to where it's generated. It's like having mini-clouds that work together with the big cloud.
Imagine Fog Computing as a network of small clouds that help process information locally.

virtualPrivateCloud.title: Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
virtualPrivateCloud.subtext: Isolated cloud resources for enhanced security within a public cloud.

content.heading: Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
paragraphs: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a private cloud space within a public cloud environment. It's like having your own private room in a large hotel.
Imagine a VPC as a secure area in a public place where only you can go.

hybridCloud.title: Hybrid Cloud
hybridCloud.subtext: Combining public and private cloud environments for flexibility.

content.heading: Hybrid Cloud
paragraphs: Hybrid Cloud combines private and public clouds to provide greater flexibility. It's like having both a private garden and access to a public park.
Imagine Hybrid Cloud as using both your own secure space and a shared area for different needs.

multiCloudStrategy.title: Multi-Cloud Strategy
multiCloudStrategy.subtext: Using multiple cloud computing services to mitigate single-provider risks.

content.heading: Multi-Cloud Strategy
paragraphs: A Multi-Cloud Strategy uses multiple cloud services to avoid reliance on a single provider. It's like shopping at different stores to get the best deals.
Imagine Multi-Cloud as using various suppliers to get the best products for your needs.

dataOps.title: DataOps
dataOps.subtext: An agile methodology for developing and maintaining data analytics.

content.heading: DataOps
paragraphs: DataOps is an automated, process-oriented methodology to improve the quality and reduce the cycle time of data analytics. It's like a production line for data.
Imagine DataOps as a factory that processes data quickly and efficiently to produce valuable insights.

bioinformatics.title: Bioinformatics
bioinformatics.subtext: Using technology to understand biological data.

content.heading: Bioinformatics
paragraphs: Bioinformatics combines biology, computer science, and information technology to analyze biological data. It's like using computers to understand life better.
Imagine Bioinformatics as a digital detective solving mysteries of living organisms.
